Package gameobjects.nonstaticobjects

Class Tear

java.lang.Object
gameobjects.GameObject
gameobjects.nonstaticobjects.NonStaticObject
gameobjects.nonstaticobjects.Tear
All Implemented Interfaces:
java.io.Serializable
public class Tear
extends NonStaticObject
A Tear is a NonStaticObject, that could be considered as a projectile. It's used by the Hero and the Monster as a way to attack.

It uses a GameObject variable as a way to know who created this Tear, and to make sure not to hit it.

There's also a Vector2 positionInitial to store the position the Tear was created, that will be used to know how far the Tear traveled.

The last two variables are, a double reach that indicate how far the Tear can go, and a boolean, trueDead to check if the Tear is truly dead or if it's dead but going through the death animation. To check what the other variable from Monster are please refer to NonStaticObject and GameObject.

See Also:
Hero, Monster, Serialized Form

    Constructs a new Tear, whose position and size are specified by the Vector2 argument, whose room is specified by the Room argument, and whose gameObject is specified by the GameObject argument.

  • Method Summary

    Modifier and Type Method Description
    void animation()
    Decreases the animationState by one, and checks if it matches a case, if so the image path will be change.
    GameObject getGameObject()
    Returns the GameObject that created the Tear.
    boolean getTrueDead()
    Get the dead state of the tear, whether it's truly dead or not.
    void updateGameObject()
    Updates Tear object movement if it's not dead.

  • Constructor Details

    • Tear

      public Tear​(Vector2 direction, Vector2 position, double damage, double reach, Room room, double speed, GameObject gameObject, @Nullable java.lang.String imagePaths, @Nullable java.util.List<java.lang.String> animationSprite)
      Constructs a new Tear, whose position and size are specified by the Vector2 argument, whose room is specified by the Room argument, and whose gameObject is specified by the GameObject argument.

      Both the imagePath and animation are Nullable, as there's a default image and animation to the Tear.

      Parameters:
      direction - the direction the new Tear will go to
      position - the position the new Tear starts at
      damage - the damage dealt by the new Tear
      reach - the reach of the new Tear
      room - the room the new Tear is in
      speed - the speed of the new Tear
      gameObject - the gameObject that created the new Tear
      imagePaths - the image of the new Tear
      animationSprite - the images that compose the new Tear animation

  • Method Details

    • updateGameObject

      public void updateGameObject()
      Updates Tear object movement if it's not dead. Otherwise it goes through the #animation().

    • animation

      public void animation()
      Decreases the animationState by one, and checks if it matches a case, if so the image path will be change.
      Specified by:
      animation in class NonStaticObject

    • getTrueDead

      public boolean getTrueDead()
      Get the dead state of the tear, whether it's truly dead or not.
      Returns:
      true if truly dead, false otherwise.

    • getGameObject

      public GameObject getGameObject()
      Returns the GameObject that created the Tear.
      Returns:
      the GameObject that created the Tear.
